reviews.text: A traditional station which looks like it has had money spent on it to keep it up to date. It has done a very good job maintaining the character of the past while providing modern facilities for the seasoned traveller or trainspotter. For my experience I found the staff very helpful and the signage clear with lots of shops and modern clean places to buy snacks or to have a meal

Hard to get excited about this place. It is functional and reasonably easy to get around. Best thing here is the Sheffield Tap. Well worth a visit or two. Uphill walk to the City centre and it's not far. Makes for an easy downhill walk back.
Amazing Trains to see  But They Need to stop cancelling them every day Because  Nobody will come.

Clear signs.  Helpful platform repeat of signs. Major multiple terminus so need these guides. Stairs modern and well - kept and be warned there are LOTS of them. Snack carts everywhere bring cash. Waiting rooms huge,warm and needed. Rely on signboard info not loudspeaker due to diesel engine trains revving when they need to. Five stars because hugely improved compared to years ago and made a long journey bearable. Not sure about the daily commute due to local lines being only 2 carriages. Vision impaired may need a human companion but stairways are sorted (yellow edge and railings).
